alert.note: Alert for Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:18PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Blaine and northeastern Hill Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 617 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 32 miles north of Beaver Creek, or 34 miles north of Havre, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Lohman, and Zurich. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
